transportAdvice: Saint-Denis has a public bus network that connects the city center and some tourist areas, though coverage can be limited and infrequent outside urban zones; taxis are widely available and recommended for reaching more remote or mountainous areas. The city center is walkable for short distances, but the island's hilly terrain and spread-out attractions make personal or hired transport the most practical option for exploring beyond downtown.

weather.description: Peak of the hot, wet cyclone season with heavy rainfall and high humidity — be prepared for tropical downpours.
Cyclone season continues with frequent intense rain and oppressive heat; outdoor activities may be disrupted.
Still wet and warm as the rainy season begins to wind down, though heavy showers remain common.
Transitional month with decreasing rainfall and slightly cooler temperatures as autumn approaches.
Noticeably cooler and drier, marking the beginning of the more pleasant dry season.
Dry and mild with comfortable temperatures — a popular time for hiking and outdoor exploration.
One of the coolest and driest months, ideal for trekking into the island's volcanic interior.
Continued dry and sunny conditions with refreshing trade winds making it excellent for outdoor activities.
Temperatures begin to rise slightly but conditions remain dry and pleasant for sightseeing.
Spring warmth returns with occasional showers as the island transitions toward the wet season.
Getting warmer and more humid with increasing rainfall as the pre-cyclone season begins.
Hot and wet with the onset of the cyclone season; expect heavy tropical rain alongside warm beach weather.
